snippet: A Washington Navy Yard subcontractor kept Aaron Alexis on the job and did not require him to seek mental health treatment, an internal investigation found.
abstract: Investigation by Hewlett-Packard of its subcontractor Experts Inc, which employed Aaron Alexis, military contractor who killed 12 people at the Washington Navy Yard, reveals that Experts knew more about his mental problems than the company has disclosed; HP concludes that Experts mishandled Alexis and cancels its business relationship with the firm.

byline.contributor: Susan Beachy and Sheelagh McNeill contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A Washington Navy Yard subcontractor kept Aaron Alexis on the job and did not require him to seek mental health treatment, an internal investigation found.

headline.main: Supervisors of Navy Yard Gunman Were Told of Issues
headline.print_headline: Supervisors Of Gunman Were Told Of Issues
